main event: A radar sighting of an unidentified object was recorded at Bergstrom Air Force Base in Austin, Texas, on January 29, 1953, lasting for 12 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed to move faster than jet aircraft, no visual sighting was made by personnel, and all contact was made via ground radar., The object appeared on the radar approximately 21 miles away and moved rapidly before stopping., The speed at which the object moved varied, from stationary to as fast as or faster than conventional aircraft., The radar return was noted to have fuzzy edges and was smaller than typical targets in size., Further investigation into atmospheric conditions was suggested as potential causes of the radar return.
witness description: Air traffic control personnel including technical sergeants
